intro: Hedeoma palmeri subsp. palmeri, commonly known as Palmer's hedeoma, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, yellowish to greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils in desert regions. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Hedeoma palmeri subsp. palmeri is often found in scrublands and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
